result.execSummary:
The defendant Genis J Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction and felony conviction, he may never possess firearms, body armor or ammunition.

Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Due to financial hardship, Court waived all costs, fes and surcharges except for the domestic abuse surcharge and the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by the end of supervision in 14CM481.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Genis J Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Genis J Wilson in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Genis J Wilson in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Kenyatta E.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 207 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 207 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Due to financial hardship, Court waived all costs, fees and surcharges except for the domestic abuse surcharge and the DNA surcharge; to be paid by the end of supervision in 14CM481.  Defendant ordered to give a DNA sample.  Court advised the defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction and felony conviction, he may never possess firearms, body armor or ammunition.

Defendant Genis J Wilson in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Jury trial date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Genis J Wilson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has matter pending in Branch 35, Judge Rosa.  Case set for status on 8-12-2015.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
FILED, RESPONSE TO SUBPOENA, REQUESTING ADJOURNMENT OF CASE

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Genis J Wilson not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case 2015CF1477 adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-5-2015 at 8:30 am and case 2014CM481 adjourned for Status Conference on 8-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  On 11-24-2014, the defendant entered a plea on case 2014CM481.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Genis J Wilson in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Genis J Wilson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court takes judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Samantha Flock.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument herad and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All available discovery was provided to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Genis J Wilson not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to the unavailability of defense counsel for the Preliminary Hearing for defendant, on case 2015CF1477, scheduled in Branch 4 today's date at 1:30 pm, both the Misdemeanor case 2014CM481 and the Preliminary Case 2015CF1477 are adjourned to Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kenyotta E

Defendant Genis J Wilson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Genis J Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Plea WITHHELD as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
